alert.note: Alert for Adjuntas; Jayuya; Lares; Utuado (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 19 at 4:19AM ADT until September 19 at 8:00AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Adjuntas County in Puerto Rico... Jayuya County in Puerto Rico... Lares County in Puerto Rico... Utuado County in Puerto Rico... * Until 700 AM AST. * At 319 AM AST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 15 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 7 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
